newsitem.title: UK: Air France to up cargo capacity to Asia.
newsitem.headline: Air France to up cargo capacity to Asia.

text.p: Air France will be increasing its cargo capacity to Asian markets in a couple of months when it will have an additional 747-200 freighter, Air France cargo general in the UK Anne Veyssie told Reuters.
"Air France is focusing on increasing its business to Asia," she added.
The additional aircraft - a conversion of an Air France 747-200 combi - should be in service by the beginning of April bringing its 747-200 freighter fleet to 12.
This will enable Air France to increase capacity on Air France's routes to Bangkok, Hong Kong, Singapore and Taipei in its summer schedule.
The current fuel surcharge is only covering part of the additional costs caused by the steep rise in fuel costs since last summer, Veyssie stated.
On December 20 Air France Cargo in Paris said it planned to increase freight rates effective mid-February but has yet to detail the rises.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
